item.title: Texts From Jane Eyre
item.author: Elizabeth Yalkut
item.description: This book is a master class in comic timing. And also in literary close-reading. Mallory Ortberg on William Blake is a REVELATION. Mallory Ortberg on the Iliad is liquid puppies in a glass. Mallory Ortberg on Wuthering Heights is everything I have ever wanted on this earth.

item.title: Prophecies, Libels and Dreams
item.author: Elizabeth Yalkut
item.description: Smart, inventive, and unusual, but sadly not to my taste — someone with a lot more interest in American mythmaking would probably get a lot more out of this. Loved the faux-scholarly “afterword” to each story, and the title is so great it hurts my heart.

item.title: A Burnable Book
item.author: Elizabeth Yalkut
item.description: Recommended to me by Jenny and Nicola, both of whom I trust. Slightly clumsy prose.

item.title: Long May She Reign
item.author: Elizabeth Yalkut
item.description: In which Meg Powers continues to be an asshole. She’s pretty great.

item.title: Stranger Magic: Charmed States and the Arabian Nights
item.author: Elizabeth Yalkut
item.description: I admit, I took this out of the library to tide me over until Warner’s Once Upon A Time: A Short History of Fairy Tale arrives.
